item.title: India to get 35 billion from Japan but no nuke deal yet
item.description: Narendra Modi on Monday extracted a pledge of nearly 35 billion in Japanese investment and financing over the next five years for infrastructure projects like smart cities and the cleaning of the Ganga
item.itunes:subtitle: Narendra Modi on Monday extracted a pledge of nearly 35 billion in Japanese investment and financing over the next five years for infrastructure projects like smart cities and the cleaning of the Ganga
item.itunes:summary: Narendra Modi on Monday extracted a pledge of nearly 35 billion in Japanese investment and financing over the next five years for infrastructure projects like smart cities and the cleaning of the Ganga

item.title: AAI to develop 50 lowcost airports
item.description: The stateowned airport operator Airports Authority of India AAI is planning to develop 50 new lowcost airports across the country to cope with the growing air traffic
item.itunes:subtitle: The stateowned airport operator Airports Authority of India AAI is planning to develop 50 new lowcost airports across the country to cope with the growing air traffic
item.itunes:summary: The stateowned airport operator Airports Authority of India AAI is planning to develop 50 new lowcost airports across the country to cope with the growing air traffic

item.title: Rights watchdog slams large number of death sentences says they have failed to curb crime
item.description: President Pranab Mukherjee has rejected 97 of the mercy petitions since assuming the top office in 2012 a human rights watch group has said stressing that death penalty has failed to act as a deterrent in the country
item.itunes:subtitle: President Pranab Mukherjee has rejected 97 of the mercy petitions since assuming the top office in 2012 a human rights watch group has said stressing that death penalty has failed to act as a deterrent in the country
item.itunes:summary: President Pranab Mukherjee has rejected 97 of the mercy petitions since assuming the top office in 2012 a human rights watch group has said stressing that death penalty has failed to act as a deterrent in the country

item.title: Taslima Nasreen visa extended for one year
item.description: Bangladeshi writer Taslima Nasreen has been given a oneyear visa by the Centre and allowed to stay in India till August 2015
item.itunes:subtitle: Bangladeshi writer Taslima Nasreen has been given a oneyear visa by the Centre and allowed to stay in India till August 2015
item.itunes:summary: Bangladeshi writer Taslima Nasreen has been given a oneyear visa by the Centre and allowed to stay in India till August 2015

item.title: PM Narendra Modis Tokyo diary
item.description: From finding a spot to pose with the chief priest in Kyoto to playing a few notes on the flute Narendra Modi has been in a good mood in Japan possibly because he feels he is among friends
item.itunes:subtitle: From finding a spot to pose with the chief priest in Kyoto to playing a few notes on the flute Narendra Modi has been in a good mood in Japan possibly because he feels he is among friends
item.itunes:summary: From finding a spot to pose with the chief priest in Kyoto to playing a few notes on the flute Narendra Modi has been in a good mood in Japan possibly because he feels he is among friends

item.title: BJP prepares to contest all seats Sena says alliance bound by Hindutva
item.description: Bharatiya Janata Party continued to mount pressure on its longtime ally the Shiv Sena by discussing observers report from Maharashtras all districts ahead of much awaited seatsharing between the two for assembly polls
item.itunes:subtitle: Bharatiya Janata Party continued to mount pressure on its longtime ally the Shiv Sena by discussing observers report from Maharashtras all districts ahead of much awaited seatsharing between the two for assembly polls
item.itunes:summary: Bharatiya Janata Party continued to mount pressure on its longtime ally the Shiv Sena by discussing observers report from Maharashtras all districts ahead of much awaited seatsharing between the two for assembly polls

item.title: Smriti Irani says listening to PMs speech on Teachers Day voluntary
item.description: Amidst the row over HRD ministrys instructions to the state to ensure PM Narendra Modis planned interaction with students on the occasion of Teachers Day was watchedlistened live in all government schools the HRD minister Smriti Irani on Monday said the event was voluntary
item.itunes:subtitle: Amidst the row over HRD ministrys instructions to the state to ensure PM Narendra Modis planned interaction with students on the occasion of Teachers Day was watchedlistened live in all government schools the HRD minister Smriti Irani on Monday said the e
item.itunes:summary: Amidst the row over HRD ministrys instructions to the state to ensure PM Narendra Modis planned interaction with students on the occasion of Teachers Day was watchedlistened live in all government schools the HRD minister Smriti Irani on Monday said the event was voluntary

item.title: 100 days of Modi sarkar Little doubt who calls the shots
item.description: In his first 100 days Narendra Modi has left no one in doubt about who calls the shots and his measured and determined approach to governance suggests that change when it comes will be significant
item.itunes:subtitle: In his first 100 days Narendra Modi has left no one in doubt about who calls the shots and his measured and determined approach to governance suggests that change when it comes will be significant
item.itunes:summary: In his first 100 days Narendra Modi has left no one in doubt about who calls the shots and his measured and determined approach to governance suggests that change when it comes will be significant

item.title: Modi100 GoMs gone focus on economic momentum
item.description: In line with his mantra of minimum government maximum governance Modi decided to scrap the GoM and Empowered GoMs which the previous UPA government used to defer contentious policy decisions The number of cabinet committees has also been reduced
item.itunes:subtitle: In line with his mantra of minimum government maximum governance Modi decided to scrap the GoM and Empowered GoMs which the previous UPA government used to defer contentious policy decisions The number of cabinet committees has also been reduced
item.itunes:summary: In line with his mantra of minimum government maximum governance Modi decided to scrap the GoM and Empowered GoMs which the previous UPA government used to defer contentious policy decisions The number of cabinet committees has also been reduced

item.title: No nuke deal yet but Japan offers Modi bullet trains
item.description: On Day 3 of Prime Minister Narendra Modis visit to Japan there was no breakthrough on the civil nuclear or defence deals but India received promises of huge investments in other sectors
item.itunes:subtitle: On Day 3 of Prime Minister Narendra Modis visit to Japan there was no breakthrough on the civil nuclear or defence deals but India received promises of huge investments in other sectors
item.itunes:summary: On Day 3 of Prime Minister Narendra Modis visit to Japan there was no breakthrough on the civil nuclear or defence deals but India received promises of huge investments in other sectors

item.title: BJPs TN allies Teachers Day cant be Guru Utsav
item.description: Two of BJPs Tamil Nadu allies on Monday opposed naming Teachers Day as Guru Utsav with PMK terming it as a discreet attempt to impose Sanskrit

item.title: Nalanda University reopens after 800 years
item.description: Around 800 years after it was razed by foreign invaders Nalanda University reopened its doors on Monday in an attempt to reclaim its ancient glory of an international knowledge destination
item.itunes:subtitle: Around 800 years after it was razed by foreign invaders Nalanda University reopened its doors on Monday in an attempt to reclaim its ancient glory of an international knowledge destination
item.itunes:summary: Around 800 years after it was razed by foreign invaders Nalanda University reopened its doors on Monday in an attempt to reclaim its ancient glory of an international knowledge destination

item.title: Not just in Perth 50 people tilt bus to rescue students in Pune
item.description: A crowd of more than 50 people came together in Pune on Friday to lift a bus and free two college students who were trapped underneath This picture now circulating on social media reminds us of a similar incident in Perth Australia a month ago
item.itunes:subtitle: A crowd of more than 50 people came together in Pune on Friday to lift a bus and free two college students who were trapped underneath This picture now circulating on social media reminds us of a similar incident in Perth Australia a month ago
item.itunes:summary: A crowd of more than 50 people came together in Pune on Friday to lift a bus and free two college students who were trapped underneath This picture now circulating on social media reminds us of a similar incident in Perth Australia a month ago

item.title: Tatra deal Tejinder Singhs bail plea dismissed held
item.description: Lt Gen retd Tejinder Singh wasnbspon Mondaynbsparrested on orders by a Delhi court which dismissed his bail plea for allegedly offering Rs 14 crore bribe to then Army Chief Gen VK Singh for clearing file pertaining to procurement of 1676 heavy mobility Tatra vehicles
item.itunes:subtitle: Lt Gen retd Tejinder Singh wasnbspon Mondaynbsparrested on orders by a Delhi court which dismissed his bail plea for allegedly offering Rs 14 crore bribe to then Army Chief Gen VK Singh for clearing file pertaining to procurement of 1676 heavy mobility Ta
item.itunes:summary: Lt Gen retd Tejinder Singh wasnbspon Mondaynbsparrested on orders by a Delhi court which dismissed his bail plea for allegedly offering Rs 14 crore bribe to then Army Chief Gen VK Singh for clearing file pertaining to procurement of 1676 heavy mobility Tatra vehicles

item.title: Centre to SC Dont cancel all coal blocks
item.description: The government on Monday appealed to the Supreme Court not to cancel all the coal blocks that have been declared illegal Attorney general Mukul Rohtagi told the court that 40 of the 218 coal blocks in the country were ready for production and they should not be scrapped
